reference.title: euscale-create-auto-scaling-group
reference.shortdesc: Creates a new auto scaling group with the specified parameters.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: euscale-create-auto-scaling-group AutoScalingGroupName --launch-configuration value --max-size value --min-size value [--availability-zones value[,valueâ€¦ ]] [--default-cooldown value ] [--desired-capacity value ] [--grace-period value ] [--health-check-type value ] [--load-balancers value[,value...] ] [--tags value[,value,...]] [--termination-policies value[,value,... ]]

row.entry: The name of the auto scaling group.
The name of the launch configuration to associate with this auto scaling group.
The maximum size of the auto scaling group.
The minimum size of the auto scaling group.
A list of availability zones for the auto scaling group.
The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start.
The number of instances that should be running in the auto scaling group.
Length of time in seconds after a new Amazon EC2 instance comes into service that Auto Scaling starts checking its health.
The type of health check: instance or load balancer. TODO: clarify euca valid values.
A comma-delimited list of load balancers used by this auto scaling group.
A comma-delimited list of tags for this auto scaling group.
A delimited list of termination policies for this auto scaling group.

section.title: Output
section.p: There is no output from this command if it is successful.
